title: Checkbox
description: Checkboxes allow users to select one or more items from a set. Checkboxes can turn an option on or off.

contentChunks.htmlValue: There's one type of checkbox in Material. Use this selection control when the user needs to select one or more options from a list.

contentChunks.footer: Checkboxes shown in unselected, selected (hover), and indeterminate states.
contentChunks.altText: 3 checkboxes in a diagram demonstrating all three states

contentChunks.htmlValue: Resources

TypeLinkStatus
DesignDesign kit (Figma)Available
M2 guideline â€“ CheckboxesAvailable
ImplementationMDC-AndroidAvailable
Jetpack ComposeAvailable
FlutterPlanned
WebPlanned
Takeaways

• Checkboxes have been in user interfaces for a long time and should be used as expected
  • It should be visible at a glance if a checkbox has been selected, and selected items should be more visually prominent than unselected items
  • Checkboxes make it easy to compare available options
What's new

• Color: New color mappings and compatibility with dynamic color
  • States: New indeterminate states as well as error states for unselected, selected, and indeterminate

contentChunks.altText: Diagram of a selected checkbox on a white background and selected checkbox on a light green background

Color

Color values are implemented through design tokens. For design, this means working with color values that correspond with tokens. For implementation, a color value will be a token that references a value. Learn more about design tokens.

contentChunks.footer: Checkboxes in a list of items.
contentChunks.altText: A list of burger additions represented with checkboxes

contentChunks.htmlValue: Usage

Use checkboxes to:

  • Select one or more options from a list
  • Present a list containing sub-selections
  • Turn an item on or off in a desktop environment

contentChunks.altText: List of 80's songs indicating choice through checkbox selection

contentChunks.htmlValue: Checkboxes should be used instead of switches if multiple options can be selected from a list.

contentChunks.footer: Checkboxes let users select one or more options from a list. A parent checkbox allows for easy selection or deselection of all items.
contentChunks.altText: List indicating choice with checkbox selection

contentChunks.footer: If a list consists of multiple options, don't use switches. Instead, use checkboxes. Checkboxes imply the items are related, and take up less visual space.
contentChunks.altText: A list with multiple switches selected

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Alternate selection controls

Checkboxes are one of several selection controls, which allow users to make choices such as selecting options or switching settings on or off.

Radio buttons and switches are alternative selection controls that can be used to enter decisions or declare preferences such as settings or dialogs.

contentChunks.altText: Diagram of 2 radio buttons, one selected and one unselected
Diagram of 2 switches, one selected and one unselected

contentChunks.htmlValue: Anatomy

contentChunks.altText: Diagram of checkbox indicating the 2 parts of its anatomy

contentChunks.htmlValue: Placement

Parent and child checkboxes

Checkboxes can have a parent-child relationship with other checkboxes.

  • When the parent checkbox is checked, all child checkboxes are checked
  • If a parent checkbox is unchecked, all child checkboxes are unchecked
  • If some, but not all, child checkboxes are checked, the parent checkbox becomes an indeterminate checkbox
Behavior

When selected, a checkbox clearly and instantly communicates its selected state.

If used to turn something on or off, the action should be immediately executed.

contentChunks.footer: Turning an item on or off using a checkbox.

contentChunks.htmlValue: Multiple checkboxes in a list can be selected.

contentChunks.footer: Selecting multiple items in a list using checkboxes.

contentChunks.htmlValue:
